page.title: 01SUMMARY OF LEOMINSTER AREA
page.content: {Leominster}is a small market town with a population of nearly 10,000 set in the heart of the Herefordshire countryside. To the north on the A49 is Ludlow and Shrewsbury, to the south is the city of Hereford. Thirty miles to the east is the city of Worcester, which has been the county headquarters of Hereford and Worcester since amalgamation in 1974. Twenty miles to the west is the Welsh border and beyond that the Black Mountains and the Brecon Beacons. { {Leominster}is the main shopping area for the farming community and the surrounding district. During the summer tourists abound, visiting the pleasant countryside and looking at the black and white houses in the town. The Priory and Grange Court are other places well worth a visit.
